TextView.android:text: Country Code
Data ID
Participant ID
Section II: MATERNAL RECALL SURVEY MODULE (ACS, uterotonics, newborn resuscitation, ENC practices)
Section II.1 ACS
Some babies are born before term and there are methods to help with their breathing.
Do you know if your baby was born before the expected date, or too soon or too early?

a) If No, were you in threatened preterm or premature labour or were you told at any point that you were at risk of your baby being born too early? INTERVIEWER TO USE LOCAL WORD FOR ‘PREMATURE’ IF APROPRIATE
Prompt: That is, before your expected due date?
b) If YES, how many days/week/months too early? Prompt: That is, before your expected due date? DEPENDING ON MOTHER’S ANSWER, WRITE ANSWER IN EITHER DAYS, WEEKS OR MONTHS
How many days/week/months too early?
Were you given any medicine or injection before your baby was born because your baby was at risk of being born too soon?
Do you know what the medicine or injection was for?
What medicine were you given? PROMPT: SHOW SAMPLES OF THE DRUGS IF AVAILABLE
How was the medicine given?
How many times were you given the medicine?
Don’t know/don’t remember
How long before your baby was born did you receive the last dose?
Section II.2 Uterotonics
I am now going to ask you some questions about what happened to you after the delivery of your baby.
Were you given any medicine immediately after the delivery of your baby?
8a. How was the medicine given? MULTIPLE SELECTION POSSIBLE- SELECT ALL RELEVANT ANSWER OPTIONS
1) Injection in your thigh or buttocks
2) IV drip or bolus
3) Tablets to swallow or hold in your mouth
4) Tablets in your rectum
5) Don’t know/don’t remember
When was the injection/tablets given? READ ANSWER CHOICES
Did the health worker tell you that you were going to be given an injection/medication immediately after birth?
Do you know what medication/drug you were given?
10a. What was the name of the medication/drug you were given? MULTIPLE SELECTION POSSIBLE- SELECT ALL RELEVANT ANSWER OPTIONS
a) Oxytocin
b) Ergometrine
c) Misoprostol
d) Other
e) Don’t know/don’t remember
Were you told the reason for the injection?
11a. What was the reason? MULTIPLE SELECTION POSSIBLE- SELECT ALL RELEVANT ANSWER OPTIONS. END SURVEY if BABY OUTCOME IS DEAD
a) To prevent heavy/severe bleeding after birth
b) Other
c) Don’t know/don’t remember
Section II.3 Essential Newborn Care Practices
Was your baby dried or wiped immediately after birth (within a few minutes)?
Was your baby placed on your chest, naked against your skin? PROMPT WITH PICTURE IF NECESSARY
What time was your baby placed against your chest? READ ANSWER CHOICES
Exact Minutes
If not placed on your chest, where was your baby put immediately after birth?
How long after the birth was your baby bathed for the first time?
IF LESS THAN 1 HOUR, RECORD 01 HOURS; IF LESS THAN 24 HOURS, RECORD HOURS; OTHERWISE RECORD DAYS.
Did you ever breastfeed your baby?
How long after birth did you first put your baby to your breast?
IF LESS THAN 1 HOUR, RECORD 01 HOURS; IF LESS THAN 24 HOURS, RECORD HOURS; OTHERWISE RECORD DAYS.
Were you given any help to breastfeed from health workers?

18. In the time after delivery when you were still in hospital, was your baby given anything to drink other than breast milk? PROMPT: Such as water, formula, tea but not including tablets/medicines? MULTIPLE SELECTION POSSIBLE- SELECT ALL RELEVANT ANSWER OPTIONS
a) Water
b) Tea
c) Formula
d) Other
e) No
f) Don’t know/don’t remember
Section II.4 Newborn Resuscitation
Did you hear your baby cry immediately after birth?
Did your baby have trouble breathing at birth?
20a. Was anything done to help your baby breathe? PROBE IF NECESSARY: that is, did anyone try to help your baby to breathe? MULTIPLE SELECTION POSSIBLE- SELECT ALL RELEVANT ANSWER OPTIONS
a) Yes
b) No, because baby was taken into another room
c) No, don’t know because mother was not well enough or e.g. having c section
d) No, don’t know because nobody told the mother
e) Don’t know/don’t remember
Was your baby vigorously rubbed with a cloth or towel or any other stimulation to help to get your baby to breathe?
Did anyone use a plastic device to help your baby breathe? PROMPT: SHOW PICTURE OF BAG AND MASK
If somebody used a plastic device to help your baby breathe, how long did they use it for?
Did anyone perform suction to your baby’s mouth or nose after birth to clean the airways?
Were any other actions taken by the health worker to help your baby to breathe?
Was your baby admitted to a neonatal ward after needing help to breathe? PROMPT: I mean to a special ward for monitoring or treatment
Did any health worker explain what happened to your baby?
What were you told happened?
Don’t know/don’t remember
Section II.5 Cord care and chlorhexidine cord cleansing
After the cord was cut, was anything applied to the stump of the cord at any time?
What was applied to the cord? (Show tube ) PROBE: Anything else? INSTRUCTIONS: SHOW A TUBE OF CHLORHEXIDINE TO THE MOTHER
PROBE: Anything else? INSTRUCTIONS: SHOW A TUBE OF CHLORHEXIDINE TO THE MOTHER
How long after the cord was cut was chlorhexidine first applied?
IF LESS THAN 1 HOUR, RECORD 01 HOURS; IF LESS THAN 24 HOURS, RECORD HOURS; OTHERWISE RECORD DAYS.
If chlorhexidine was applied, who applied the treatment within the last 24hours?
Were you told the reason why the treatment was being applied to the stump?
What was the reason?
Don’t know
Were you given the medicine to take home?
INTERVIEWER COMMENTS
